register.description: This register enables the domain power state transition. It controls the SW supervised clock domain state transition between ON-PER and ON-INPER states. It also hold one status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the TIMER6 CLKTIMER clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the TIMER5 CLKTIMER clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the SPI_GCLK clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the I2C _FCLK clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the GPIO3_GDBCLK clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the GPIO2_ GDBCLK clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the GPIO1_GDBCLK clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the LCD clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the TIMER4 CLKTIMER clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the TIMER3 CLKTIMER clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the TIMER2 CLKTIMER clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the TIMER7 CLKTIMER clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the CAN_CLK clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the UART_GFCLK clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the L4LS_GCLK clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the L4 SLOW clock domain in PER power domain.

bitenum.description: NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.
SW_SLEEP: Start a software forced sleep transition on the domain.
SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.

register.description: This register enables the domain power state transition. It controls the SW supervised clock domain state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also hold one status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the L3S_GCLK clock in the domain.
Controls the clock state transition of the L3 Slow clock domain.

bitenum.description: NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.
SW_SLEEP: Start a software forced sleep transition on the domain.
SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.

register.description: This register enables the domain power state transition. It controls the SW supervised clock domain state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also hold one status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the L4FW clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is gated
Corresponding clock is active

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the L4 Firewall clock domain.

bitenum.description: NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.
SW_SLEEP: Start a software forced sleep transition on the domain.
SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.

register.description: This register enables the domain power state transition. It controls the SW supervised clock domain state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also hold one status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the MCASP_GCLK clock in the domain.
This field indicates the state of the CLKACTIVITY_CPTS_RFT_GCLK clock in the domain.
This field indicates the state of the L3_GCLK clock in the domain.
This field indicates the state of the MMC_GCLK clock in the domain.
This field indicates the state of the EMIF_GCLK clock in the domain.
Controls the clock state transition of the L3 clock domain.

bitenum.description: NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.
SW_SLEEP: Start a software forced sleep transition on the domain.
SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.

register.description: This register manages the CPSW clocks.

bitfield.description: Module standby status. This bit is warm reset insensitive when CPSW RESET_ISO is enabled

bitenum.description: Module is functional (not in standby)
Module is in standby

bitfield.description: Module idle status. This bit is warm reset insensitive when CPSW RESET_ISO is enabled

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed. This bit is warm reset insensitive when CPSW RESET_ISO is enabled

bitenum.description: Module is disable by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.

bitfield.description: Module idle status.

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.

register.description: This register enables the domain power state transition. It controls the SW supervised clock domain state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also hold one status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the CPSW_5MHZ_GCLK clock in the domain.
This field indicates the state of the CPSW_50MHZ_GCLK clock in the domain.
This field indicates the state of the CPSW_250MHZ_GCLK clock in the domain.
This field indicates the state of the L4HS_GCLK clock in the domain.
Controls the clock state transition of the L4 Fast clock domain.

bitenum.description: NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.
SW_SLEEP: Start a software forced sleep transition on the domain.
SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.

register.description: This register manages the L4 Fast clocks.

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
